alert.note: Alert for Brown; Jackson; Nemaha (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 9:51PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Pottawatomie, southern Nemaha, Jackson, Brown and southeastern Marshall Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 950 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles southeast of Falls City to 6 miles southeast of Seneca to 3 miles northwest of Lillis. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. An outflow boundary was located ahead of the line and may provide wind gusts up to 50 MPH. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Holton, Hiawatha, Sabetha, Horton, Onaga, Centralia, Wetmore, Mayetta, Everest, Fairview, Robinson, Morrill, Emmett, Whiting, Denison, Circleville, Corning, Netawaka, Soldier and Havensville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for northeastern Kansas.
